roleset.name: extend, lengthen
roleset.note: STRETCH-V NOTES: Comparison to 'extend'. Member of Vncls crane-40.3.2, bend-45.2, meander-47.7. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from stretch.01-v)

role.descr: agent, entity making something be longer
EXT or TMP, by how much or until when

example.name: with EXT
example.text: The limits to legal absurdity stretched another notch this week.

example.name: transitive
example.text: In the past year , both-1 have tried [*-1] to stretch the limits of their businesses .

example.name: with temporal EXT
example.text: Most are from independent producers instead of regulated utilities , and Westinghouse believes it will ride a wave of demand stretching over the next six years .

example.name: with start and end points
example.text: Kingdom of Morocco -- $ 208 million [*U*] ( redemption amount ) of zero-coupon government trust certificates , with maturities stretching from May 15 , 1990 , to Nov. 15 , 1999 , priced [*]at yields ranging from 8.23 % to 8.43 % .

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Their common denominator has been their stretching of boundaries of motoring endurance in extreme conditions and on challenging terrain.
example.arg: of boundaries of motoring endurance in extreme conditions and on challenging terrain

roleset.name: to extend to a greater or the full length

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Whereas conventional securities financings are structured to be sold quickly , Wall Street 's new penchant for leveraged buy-outs and junk bonds is resulting in long-term lending commitments that-2 [*T*-2] stretch out for months or years .
